page.title: 16FORDWICH
page.content: A popular tourist attraction, approx. 3m from Canterbury. Fordwich has a wealth of red-brick, peg-tiled period properties. It is a well kept dormitory village. It iso visualise Fordwich as a thriving port but in Roman & Medieval times it was the highest navigable point of the River Stour for larger vessels.Its famous Village Hall, the smallest in Kent is now a Museum. There are two shops,one sells souvenirs, post rds etc., the other sells sweets , cigarettes, dairy produce & frozen food.Two village pubs attract visitors & both offer car parking, which is controlled in the village by yellow lines. St. Mary the Virgin Church of England has a small church yard which is still in use and is well maintained. There is access to the Westbere lakes which are popular haunts of anglers & bird watchers.
